name: 英文臺灣文獻
description: 本課程將介紹並閱讀不同年代有關台灣的英文文獻。一方面提升學生的英文閱讀與理解能力，同時也培養學生，能從不同的文化和時代的角度，了解台灣。
goals: 培養學生高級英文閱讀能力。
培養學生以英文了解並表達深度台灣文化以及社會現狀的能力。
培養學生從不同的觀點和縱深，思考並認識台灣的能力。
培養學生利用資料庫等工具的能力，以利進一步發展獨立研究之能力。
syllabus:
**週**1  **9****月 13****日** Introduction 

Explanation and handout of the Syllabus

**週**2 **9****月 20****日** Introducing Taiwan Studies Materials

This class introduces relevant materials that discuss retrospect and prospects of Taiwan Studies in monographs, edited volumes and journals:

_Routledge Handbook of Contemporary Taiwan_, edited by Gunter Schubert, 2016

_International Journal of Taiwan Studies_ (IJTS), published by Brill, 2017

Students prepare: Heylen, Ann and Scott Sommers(2010) “Introduction” in Heylen, Ann and Sommers, Scott (eds) _Becoming Taiwan. From Colonialism to Democracy_, Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz Verlag, pp.3-10

**週**3  **9****月 27****日** **What is Taiwan Studies? Overview of the discipline****／** **什麼是台灣研究，探討領域**

Discussion: Heylen, Ann and ScottSommers (2010) “Introduction” in Heylen, Ann and Sommers, Scott (eds) _Becoming Taiwan. From Colonialism toDemocracy_, Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz Verlag, pp. 3-10  The discussion will relate this text to the updated publications based on _Routledge Handbook of Contemporary Taiwan_ and _International Journal of Taiwan Studies_ (IJTS).

Students prepare the texts for next week (準備下禮拜的課本文)

**週**4  **10****月 4****日**  **Taiwan island history: indigenous, archaeology and naming** **／台灣島史；原住民，考古學與地名**

Reading materials (閱讀資料)

Hsieh, Shih-Chung “From Shanbao to Yuanzhumin: Taiwanese Aborigines in Transition,” Murray Rubinstein (ed.) _The other Taiwan: 1945 to the present_, 1991(New York: M.E. Sharpe), pp. 392-403.

Hsieh, Chiao-Min “Sequent Occupance and Place Names,” Ronald Knapp (ed.) _China’s Island Frontier. Studies in the Historical Geography of Taiwan_, reprint Taipei: SMC Publishing, 1996 (Honolulu: The University Press of Hawaii, 1980), pp.107-114.

Vocabulary & concept study (詞會研究): _The Concise History of Taiwan, Chinese-English Bilingual Edition_ (chapter 1)

Students prepare the texts for next week (準備下禮拜的課本文): Chiu, Hsin-Hui, “Cross-cultural encounters, colonial ‘civilizing process’, and indigenous agency”, _The Colonial ‘Civilizing Process’ in Dutch Formosa, 1624-1662_ Leiden, Boston: Brill, 2008, pp. 3-12.

 **週**5  **10****月 11****日** **Taiwan in the 17th century : Dutch Formosa and Spanish Hermosa****／ 17****世紀的台灣：荷蘭與西班亞的時代**

Discussion of the text Chiu, Hsin-Hui, “Cross-cultural encounters, colonial ‘civilizing process’, and indigenous agency,” _The Colonial ‘Civilizing Process’ in Dutch Formosa, 1624-1662_ Leiden, Boston: Brill, 2008, pp. 3-12.

Vocabulary & concept study (詞會研究): _The Concise History of Taiwan, Chinese-English Bilingual Edition_ (chapter 1), continued. 

Students prepare the texts for next week (準備下禮拜的課本文): 

**週**6  **10****月 18****日  Selected Readings on Dutch Formosa**

Reading materials (閱讀資料): selected chapters from Blussé, Leonard (ed.) _Around rand About Formosa. Essays in Honor of Professor Ts’ao Yung-ho_, Taipei: Ts’ao Yung-ho Foundation for Culture and Education, 2003.

**週**7  **10****月 25****日**  **Taiwan seen from the perspective as an Immigrant Society: Taiwan in the 18th century and 19th Century** 

(1) Wen-Hsiung Hsu “Frontier Social Organisation and Social Disorder in Ch’ing Taiwan”, Ronald Knapp (ed.) _China’s Island Frontier. Studies in the Historical Geography of Taiwan_, reprint Taipei: SMC Publishing, 1996 (Honolulu: The University Press of Hawaii, 1980), pp.87-105.

(2) Tao-chang Chiang, “Walled Cities and Towns in Taiwan,” in Ronald Knapp (ed.) _China’s Island Frontier. Studies in the Historical Geography of Taiwan_, reprint Taipei: SMC Publishing, 1996 (Honolulu: The University Press of Hawaii, 1980), pp.117-141.

(3) Chen, Chiukun “From Landlords to Local Strongman: The Transformation of Local Elites in Mid-Ch ing Taiwan, 1780-1862” in Murray Rubinstein (ed) _Taiwan. A New History_ New York: Sharpe, 1999, pp. 133-162.

(4) Gardella, Robert “From Treaty Ports to Provincial Status, 1860-1894” in Murray Rubinstein (ed) _Taiwan. A New History_ New York: Sharpe, 1999, pp. 163-200.

(5) Harrell, Stevan “From xiedou to yijun: The decline of ethnicity in northernTaiwan,1885-1895” _Late Imperial China_ 11.1, 1990 pp. 99-127.

**週**8  **11****月 1****日**  **Taiwan seen from the perspective as an Immigrant Society** : **New Immigrants and Globalization**

**Academic Activity**

**週**9 **11****月 8****日**    **期中考 Mid-term Exam**

**週**10 **11****月 15****日**  **Discussion Mid-term Exam Results**

**週**11  **11****月 22****日** **Colonization:** **Taiwan and Japan, General reading****／日治時代的台灣：社會的變遷**

Vocabulary & concept study (詞會研究): _The Concise History of Taiwan, Chinese-English Bilingual Edition_ (chapter 3, section 2 and 3), pp. 131-157. 

**週**12  **11****月 29****日**  **Taiwan and Japan: Topics****／日治時代的台灣：主題**

This class will give an overview of research articles that deal with specific topics in Taiwan Studies on the Japanese colonial period.

Elective reading:

(1) Lamley, Harry J. “Taiwan Under Japanese Rule, 1895-1945: The Vicissitudes of Colonialism,” Murray Rubinstein (ed) _Taiwan.A New History_ New York: Sharpe, 1999, pp. 201-260

(2) Chou, Wan-yao “The _Kominka_ Movement in Taiwan and Korea: Comparisons and Interpretations,” Peter Duus, Ramon H Myers and Mark R Peattie (eds.) _The Japanese  Wartime Empire, 1931-1945_, Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1996,pp. 40-70.

**週**13  **12****月 6****日**  **Taiwan today** **／當代的台灣 : 1945-1987**

Discussion and presentation of the text: Bosco, Joseph “The Emergence of a Taiwanese Popular Culture,” Murray A. Rubinstein (ed) _The Other Taiwan, 1945 to the present_ New York: Sharpe, 1994, pp. 392-403. This text will be contextualized alongside societal changes since 1994.

Vocabulary & concept study (詞會研究): _The Concise History of Taiwan, Chinese-English Bilingual Edition_ (chapter 4, section 1 and 2), pp. 159-181.

**週**14  **12****月 13****日**  **Taiwan today** **／當代的台灣：1987-**  

Discussion and presentation of the text:  Gold, Thomas B. “Civil Society and Taiwan’s Quest for Identity,” Stevan Harrell and Huang Chün-chieh (eds) _Cultural Change in Postwar Taiwan_ Taipei: SMC reprint, 1994, pp. 47-68.

Vocabulary & concept study (詞會研究): _The Concise History of Taiwan, Chinese-English Bilingual Edition_ (chapter 4, section 3 and 4), pp. 182- 201.

Elective Reading:

Hsiau, A-chin “Language Ideology in Taiwan: The KMT’s Language Policy, the Taiyu Movement, and Ethnic Politics,” _Journal of Multilingual and Multicultural Development_ 18:4, 1997, pp. 302-315.

**週**15  **12** **月 20****日Taiwan today topics** **／當代的台灣：主題（二）**

This class will give an overview of book series that deal with specific topics in Taiwan Studies present day: democracy, social movements, literature, and media studies  

Introducing the edited volume David Blundell (ed) _Taiwan Since Martial Law; Society, Culture, Politics, Economy_ Taipei: Shung-Yi, NTU/ Berkeley, 2012.

**週**16  **12****月 27****日**  **Taiwanese and World Citizens**

A selection of articles _Routledge Handbook of Contemporary Taiwan_ that focus on Taiwan’s economic development and international relations

Vocabulary & concept study (詞會研究): _The Concise History of Taiwan, Chinese-English Bilingual Edition_ (chapter 5), pp. 203-233.

**週**17  **1****月 3****日  Explanation of the Exam**

Presentation and selection of the material: **Series: Taiwan literature English translation** series (1996-) Santa Barbara, California: Forum for Study of World Literature

**Exam: students read a short story and use the text material discussed throughout the course to situate the story in its historical/ contemporary context.**

Selection of short stories in translation (colonial period)

Cheng Ch’ing-wen, “ The White Period”, TL1, (1996), pp. 18-33

Lu He-jo, “The Oxcart”, TL2 (1997), pp. 19-44

Ts’ai Ch’iu-t’ung, “Elder Brother Xing”, TL19 (2006), pp. 81-90

Yang K’uei, “Mother Goose gets Married”, TL 20 (2007), pp. 73-10

Auvini Kadresengan, “A Dewdrop on a Taro leaf”, TL 22 (2008), pp. 55-73

**週**18  **1****月 10****日  End-term Exam**
